project_description: A simple Flutter app that displays a text, which changes between 'Cat' and 'Dog' when tapped.
architecture_overview: The project follows a modular architecture with a clear separation of concerns using the Cubit pattern for state management. The app consists of a single screen which displays a text and an icon. The text and icon change when the text is tapped.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: Tap text
HomeScreen -> TextCubit: toggleText()
TextCubit -> TextState: Update state
HomeScreen -> TextDisplay: Update UI
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using a Cubit called TextCubit. The Cubit maintains a state (TextState) which holds the current text to be displayed ('Cat' or 'Dog'). When the text is tapped, the toggleText method of the Cubit is called, which toggles the text and updates the state. The UI listens for state changes and re-renders with the updated text.
navigation_flow: The app consists of a single screen (HomeScreen). Navigation is not implemented as the app has only one screen.
